medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic low-back pain and intermittent left-sided sciatica.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms first appeared in 1979 after a traffic accident, at age 19. Over the years, he experienced various episodes of back pain and sciatica, with notable worsening of symptoms due to his occupation as a bricklayer. In 1998, he had recurrent low-back pain and bilateral sciatica that developed over a 6-month period. Symptoms improved and disappeared after treatment, remaining symptom-free for 3 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient experienced a brain injury and an L-4 burst fracture in 1979, leading to paraparesis. He underwent multiple surgeries related to back issues and had periods of improvement followed by new complications such as L-4 septic pseudarthrosis.
medical_history.social_history: The patient worked as a bricklayer, which may have contributed to the worsening of his symptoms.
